intro: Varronia lantanoides, commonly known as the sweetleaf tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is valued for its ornamental beauty and medicinal properties. Varronia lantanoides is also noted for its ability to tolerate partial shade and poor soil conditions.
